009package imagingbook.common.geometry.hulls;
010
011import java.awt.Shape;
012import java.awt.geom.Line2D;
013import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.Segment;
019import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.Vector2D;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.hull.ConvexHull2D;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.hull.MonotoneChain;
022
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
026import imagingbook.common.geometry.shape.ShapeProducer;
027
028/**
029 * This class serves to calculate the convex hull of a binary region
030 * or a closed contour, given as a sequence of point coordinates.
031 * It is based on the convex hull implementation provided by the
032 * Apache Commons Math library, in particular classes 
033 * {@link ConvexHull2D} and {@link MonotoneChain}.
034 * 
035 * @author W. Burger
036 * @version 2022/06/24
037 */
038public class ConvexHull implements ShapeProducer {
039        
040        private final ConvexHull2D hull;
041        private final Pnt2d[] vertices;
042        
043        /**
044         * Constructor.
045         * 
046         * @param points a (iterable) set of 2D sample points
047         */
048        public ConvexHull(Iterable<Pnt2d> points) {
049                List<Vector2D> pts = convertToVector2D(points);
050                if (pts.size() < 1) {
051                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 1 point required for convex hull");
052                }
053                this.hull = new MonotoneChain().generate(pts);
054                Vector2D[] vecs = hull.getVertices();
055                this.vertices = new Pnt2d[vecs.length];
056                for (int i = 0; i < vecs.length; i++) {
057                        vertices[i] = PntDouble.from(vecs[i]);
058                }
059        }
060        
061        /**
062         * Constructor.
063         * 
064         * @param points an array of 2D sample points
065         */
066        public ConvexHull(Pnt2d[] points) {
067                this(() -> Arrays.stream(points).iterator());
068        }
069        
070        // public methods ------------------------
071        
072        /**
073         * Returns a sequence of 2D points on the convex hull
074         * (in counter-clockwise order).
075         * 
076         * @return sequence of 2D points on the convex hull
077         */
078        public Pnt2d[] getVertices() {
079                return this.vertices;
080        }
081        
082        @Deprecated
083        public Line2D[] getSegments() {
084                Segment[] origSegments = hull.getLineSegments();
085                Line2D[] newSegments = new Line2D.Double[origSegments.length];
086                for (int i = 0; i < origSegments.length; i++) {
087                        Segment seg = origSegments[i];
088                        Vector2D start = seg.getStart();
089                        Vector2D end = seg.getEnd();
090                        newSegments[i] = new Line2D.Double(start.getX(), start.getY(), end.getX(), end.getY());
091                }
092                return newSegments;
093        }
094        
095        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
096        
097        private static List<Vector2D> convertToVector2D(Iterable<Pnt2d> points) {
098                List<Vector2D> vecs = new ArrayList<Vector2D>();
099                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
100                        vecs.add(new Vector2D(p.getX(), p.getY()));
101                }
102                return vecs;
103        }
104
105        @Override
106        public Shape getShape(double scale) {
107                if (vertices.length < 2) {      // degenerate case (single point)
108                        return vertices[0].getShape(scale);
109                }
110                else {
111                        Path2D path = new Path2D.Double(Path2D.WIND_NON_ZERO, 4);
112                        path.moveTo(vertices[0].getX(), vertices[0].getY());
113                        for (int i = 1; i < vertices.length; i++) {
114                                path.lineTo(vertices[i].getX(), vertices[i].getY());
115                        }
116                        path.closePath();
117                        return path;
118                }
119        }
120        
121        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
122        
123        public static final double DefaultContainsTolerance = 1e-12;
124        
125        public boolean contains(Pnt2d p) {
126                return contains(p, DefaultContainsTolerance);
127        }
128        
129        /**
130         * Checks if this convex hull contains the specified point.
131         * This method is used instead of {@link Path2D#contains(double, double)}
132         * to avoid false results due to roundoff errors.
133         * 
134         * @param p some 2D point
135         * @param tolerance positive quantity for being outside
136         * @return true if the point is inside the hull
137         */
138        public boolean contains(Pnt2d p, double tolerance) {
139                for (int i = 0; i < vertices.length; i++) {
140                        int j = (i + 1) % vertices.length;
141                        AlgebraicLine line = AlgebraicLine.from(vertices[i], vertices[j]);
142                        double dist = line.getSignedDistance(p);
143                        // positive signed distance means that the point is to the left
144                        if (dist + tolerance < 0) {
145                                return false;
146                        }
147                }
148                return true;
149        }
150
151}
